content.body: @usharma:igalia.com I can share the invite letter I sent out for the Seattle meeting so you don't have to write your own
content.formatted_body: @ryzokuken I can share the invite letter I sent out for the Seattle meeting so you don't have to write your own

content.body: okay, I'll prepare one and send it your way.

I'd like to tweak the ecma262 CONTRIBUTING.md to be more explicit about not submitting proposals to the ecma262 repo. It's a minor tweak but since this is arguably speaking for the committee as a whole people should maybe have a look, and also it would be nice to get sign off from a chair or chairs https://github.com/tc39/ecma262/pull/3575

meat of it is removing

> For small changes to ECMAScript, you can contribute by filing an issue or a pull request against the current text of ECMA-262 standard in this repository.

and adding

> **Please do not open issues or pull requests in this repository to suggest new features.** See the [new feature proposals](#new-feature-proposals) section below for more details.

For small changes to ECMAScript, you can contribute by filing an issue or a pull request against the current text of ECMA-262 standard in this repository.

and adding

content.body: it also removes the suggestion to use PRs to "make behavior more consistent in an edge case" or "match what is implemented by the large majority of actual implementations", even though those are appropriate as normative PRs, because even web-reality normative PRs need a champion like anything else
